How to swat a fly. First of all the fly has to land and stay sitting some place where you can do this, ideally a countertop or other flat surface with enough room on either side of the fly. Position both hands on either side of the fly about 6 in away, most of the time the fly will fly away at this point providing it doesn't, bring both hands together rapidly as though you were going to clap. Right before reaching the fly lift your hands up about 1 or 2 in then smack them together. Ideally the fly should be right between your hands and will get smacked. This is because the fly having to try to dodge two obstacles won't be able to get away. The reason you lift your hands at the last second is because the fly jumps straight up and you want to catch him smack in the middle of your palm.
The reason this works is because if you approach a fly from one direction it will fly in the other automatically without thinking about it. By presenting the fly with two obstacles coming at it at the same time the fly has to think for a brief instant and it usually flies straight up. This positions it directly between your two incoming hands hence lifting at the last second your hands up an inch or so
